3.3a.definition: a type of storage that is directly accessed by the CPU.

the devices within the computer that are directly accessible by the CPU; there are two types of memory â€“ RAM and ROM; memory is different to hard disk drives, for example, which are known as storage devices
primary memory that can be written to or read from
primary memory that cannot be written to (changed) and can only be read
describes memory that loses its contents when the power is turned off

3.3b.definition: a type of storage that is designed to store data permanently, until it is deleted by the user.

3.3c.definition: a type of secondary storage that uses the properties of magnetism to store data.
a type of secondary storage that uses lasers to store data.
a type of secondary storage that uses transistors to store data.
an electronic circuit, where transistors are set on a semiconductor material, such as silicon.
the intersection of the rows and columns of transistors in solid-state storage.
a device that acts as a switch or gate for electronic signals.
a component that controls the flow of electric current.
a component that can store electrical charge.
using two recording layers in storage media such as DVDs and some Blu-rays
the total guaranteed number of times data can be written to or read from a solid state drive (SSD) in its usable life cycle

3.3d.definition: a type of memory that can be used as an extension to the RAM.
a problem in a hard disk drive (HDD) caused by excessive swapping in and out of data causing a high rate of head movements during virtual memory operations
the point at which the execution of a program comes to a halt because the system is so busy moving data in and out of memory rather than actually executing the program

3.3e.definition: data storage that is owned by a third party and accessed by the user, using the internet.
a component that acts as a central resource for the storage of data and applications or for providing a service.

3.3f.definition: the unnecessary storing of the same data on several storage devices at the same time
